]]> By: Catherine http://workitmom.com/bloggers/workingcloset/2007/10/26/no-one-wants-to-see-your-underwear-or-maybe-they-do/#comment-753 Catherine Fri, 26 Oct 2007 17:57:14 +0000 http://workitmom.com/bloggers/workingcloset/2007/10/26/no-one-wants-to-see-your-underwear-or-maybe-they-do/#comment-753 Maybe I'm too literal, but it is called *under*wear right? No one needs to see it. Camisoles aren't so much underwear these days. Not only should things not be sticking out, the colors should be complimentary. Don't wear your black pushup under your skin tight white sweater, even if your husband does work in the same office. Light colored pants deserve light colored undies. Maybe I’m too literal, but it is called *under*wear right? No one needs to see it. Camisoles aren’t so much underwear these days.

Not only should things not be sticking out, the colors should be complimentary. Don’t wear your black pushup under your skin tight white sweater, even if your husband does work in the same office. Light colored pants deserve light colored undies.

]]> By: heels http://workitmom.com/bloggers/workingcloset/2007/10/26/no-one-wants-to-see-your-underwear-or-maybe-they-do/#comment-752 heels Fri, 26 Oct 2007 17:32:39 +0000 http://workitmom.com/bloggers/workingcloset/2007/10/26/no-one-wants-to-see-your-underwear-or-maybe-they-do/#comment-752 I have an interesting, lace-edged, see-through camisole on today, but it's under my not see through shirt. The shirt is a little more low-cut than I like and the camisole helps me feel more covered up. I'm not sure that anyone would really know it's a camisole and not just part of the shirt. Otherwise, I try very hard to never let my undergarments show. I don't think you can ever really look professional or put-together if they do. I have an interesting, lace-edged, see-through camisole on today, but it’s under my not see through shirt. The shirt is a little more low-cut than I like and the camisole helps me feel more covered up. I’m not sure that anyone would really know it’s a camisole and not just part of the shirt. Otherwise, I try very hard to never let my undergarments show. I don’t think you can ever really look professional or put-together if they do.
